About Me

Let me tell you a few things...

BIO

Hello! I'm Kyrian, a software/devops engineer based in Lagos, Nigeria.

I am professionally connected with the web development industry and information technology for many years and have developed strong abilities in management and fostered a reputation as a key contributor through organization and leadership skills. As a team player, I am collaborative with peers and search for ways to integrate valuable insights. I have proven my ability to facilitate positive change and collective effort. My goal is to always build products that provide pixel-perfect user interfaces by applying site reliablity engineering principles in the delivery of an IT project.

Shortly after i earned my degree in Information Technology at Federal University of Technology Owerri, I joined the engineering team at Eazox as the team lead where we worked on a wide variety of interesting projects. Currently, I mentor aspiring developers in the Google Africa Developer Scholarship to become professionals with skills that can get them opportunities after the program.

Here are few technologies i've been working with recently
  • React . Next . Node . Express . Javascript
  • Opencart . Wordpress . Git . Html & (s)css
  • Kubernetes . Docker . Terraforrm . Jenkins
  • Amazon Web Services . Google Cloud Platform . Microsoft Azure

Google Africa Developer Scholarship

Mentor

June 2020 - Present

  • The Google Africa Developer Scholarship program has sponsored 30,000 aspiring developers in Africa to skill up with Pluralsight Skills, supported by the Andela Learning Community.
  • This is a Grow with Google, Andela, and Pluralsight partnership targeting to support software developers in Africa on Mobile Web, Android, and Google Cloud courses.
  • The aim of this program is to continuously engage with aspiring and existing developers on these tracks to become professional developers with skills that can get them opportunities after the program.
